testcase.brief: Group-attribute map is working with AD
testcase.description: Topology to use Topology 1 Description Group-attribute map is working with AD Pre-condition -a local radius server must be configed first -APâ€™s clock should be sync to the AD server via a ntp server -setup a ssid using wpa2-aes-802.1x,radius server is local -config ldap attribute from AD side, default: memberOf Test procedure -config a minimal AD -config attribute map on AP side -config a group with the same name as the memberOf group on AP -client connect to ssid with the right account Expect result 1. check the config,sh run and show aaa radius-server to make sure 2. check the debug info,right attributes is contained in the access-accept 3. client pass auth success,show auth,sh roa ca,sh ssid xxx st to make sure 4. if group-attribute map is configed,other attribute maps should be ignored 5. ping gateway to make sure the connect is setup correctly

step.telnet: -v "security-object autoap security aaa radius primary ${ap1.forwards.ip}" -v "user-profile vlan${tb.vlan2}" -v "user-profile vlan${tb.vlan2} vlan-id ${tb.vlan2} attribute ${tb.vlan2}" -v "user-group vlan${tb.vlan2}" -v "user-group vlan${tb.vlan2} user-attribute ${tb.vlan2}" -v "aaa radius-server local db-type active-directory primary server ${pub.ad1.ip}" -v "aaa radius-server local db-type active-directory primary domain ${pub.ad1.name} fullname ${pub.ad1.realm} default" -v "aaa radius-server local db-type active-directory primary domain ${pub.ad1.name} binddn ${pub.ad1.binddn} password ${pub.ad1.bindpwd}" -v "aaa radius-server local db-type active-directory primary login admin-user ${pub.ad1.admin} password ${pub.ad1.adminpwd}" -v "aaa radius-server local user-group vlan${tb.vlan2}" -v "aaa radius-server local attr-map group-attr-name memberOf" -v "aaa radius-server local en" -v "save config" -v "save config users"

step.desc: show status of radius server on AP1

step.log-match: -p "RADIUS: The RADIUS server accepted user \'${pub.ad1.username}_gid${tb.vlan2}\' through the NAS at ${ap1.forwards.ip}" -f ${log.dir}/${log.file}

include.args: ap1, sta1, wpa2-aes-8021x, WPA2/CCMP, wpa2-8021x, aes
